      • intersect

        public static pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA intersect(pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA arg1,
                              pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA arg2,
                              pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA... args)

      • cartesian

        public static pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA cartesian(java.lang.String opType,
                              pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA arg1,
                              pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA arg2,
                              pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA... args)
        Computes the cartesian product of the automata (minimum of two). The resulting automaton will either have no final states or be the union, intersection, difference or XOR of the automata, deppending on the specified type for the operation.

        After the cartesian product is calculated, the resulting automaton will have a state for every combination of states of the supplied automata.

        Operation types: UNION - Computes the union of the languages accepted by the automata INTERSECTION - Computes the intersection of the languages accepted by the automata XOR - Computes the exclusive or of the languages accepted by the automata DIFF - Computes the difference between the languages accepted by the automata, in the same order as they are supplied NONE - Resulting automaton will have no final states

        Parameters:
        opType - indicates the desired operation type and must have one of the following values: "union", "intersection", "xor", "diff", "none".
        args - array of automata to operate with
        Returns:
        returns a new automaton that is the cartesian product of all the supplied automata

      • diff

        public static pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA diff(pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA arg1,
                         pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA arg2,
                         pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA... args)
        Computes the difference between several automata. (Minimum of two).
        Parameters:
        args - array of automata to operate with
        Returns:
        returns a new eNFA that is the difference between the automata

      • complement

        public static pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA complement(pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA lhs)
        Creates a new automaton from the given one and complements it. I.e. it will accept strings iff they were not accepted by the original automaton.
        Parameters:
        lhs - FSA to complement
        Returns:
        returns a new automaton that is the complement of lhs

      • minimize

        public static pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA minimize(pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA lhs)
        Creates a new automaton from the given one and makes it minimal. If automaton is not deterministic, it will be determinized first.
        Parameters:
        lhs - FSA to minimize
        Returns:
        returns a new deterministic automaton equivalent to lhs but minimal

      • insert_automaton

        public static pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA insert_automaton(pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA lhs,
                                     java.lang.String origin,
                                     pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA transition,
                                     java.lang.String destination)
        Inserts an automaton in another automaton. i.e. to get from the specified origin state to the destination state must traverse the whole automaton to be inserted.

        Will rename states of the resulting automaton if there is a name conflict between the nodes of both automata.

        Parameters:
        lhs - original automaton
        origin - name of the source state
        transition - automaton that specifies the language for the state transition
        destination - name of the destination state
        Returns:
        returns a new automaton with the new transitions

      • remove_e

        public static pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA remove_e(pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA lhs)
        Creates a new automaton from the given one and removes all empty transitions from it. (eNFA to NFA)
        Parameters:
        lhs - eNFA to convert
        Returns:
        returns a new automaton equivalent to lhs but without empty transitions

      • totalize

        public static pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA totalize(pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA lhs)
        Creates a new automaton from the given one and makes it total.

        I.e. Every state will have at least one transition for every character in the automaton's alphabet. Previously undefined transitions will lead to a new trap state.

        Parameters:
        lhs - FSA to totalize
        Returns:
        returns a new automaton equivalent to lhs but total

      • remove_unreachable

        public static pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA remove_unreachable(pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA lhs)
        Creates a new automaton from the given one and removes all it's unreachable states.
        Parameters:
        lhs - FSA to convert
        Returns:
        returns a new automaton equivalent to lhs but without unreachable states

      • remove_useless

        public static pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA remove_useless(pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA lhs)
        Creates a new automaton from the given one and removes all it's useless states. A state is useless if it is a trap state (cannot reach a final state).

        However, the initial state is always kept.

        Parameters:
        lhs - FSA to convert
        Returns:
        returns a new automaton equivalent to lhs but without useless states

      • write_dot

        public static java.lang.Object write_dot(pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA lhs,
                         java.lang.String fileName)
                                  throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Generates and writes dot output for a given automaton.
        Parameters:
        lhs - automaton to write as dot
        fileName - path where to write the output
        Returns:
        always returns null
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if it fails to open a PrintStream for fileName

      • print_dot

        public static java.lang.Object print_dot(pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA lhs)
        Generates and prints dot output for a given automaton to System.out.
        Parameters:
        lhs - automaton to write as dot
        Returns:
        always returns null

      • to_regex

        public static java.lang.String to_regex(pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA lhs)
        Computes a regex from the given automaton. Empty parenthesis (i.e. "()") indicade empty strings (from epsilon transitions and such).
        Parameters:
        lhs - automaton to convert to regex
        Returns:
        returns a string containing the regex for the given automaton

      • write_code

        public static java.lang.Object write_code(java.lang.String language,
                          pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA lhs,
                          java.lang.String fileName)
                                   throws java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException,
                                          java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                          java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Generates and writes code output for the implementation of a given automaton in the specified language. The generated code exports an acceptance method which allows to test whether a given string is accepted by the automaton or not.
        Parameters:
        language - language in which to generate the code
        lhs - automaton for which to generate code implementation
        fileName - path where to write the output
        Returns:
        returns an invocation for the write method associated with the specified language
        Throws:
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - if the underlying method throws an exception
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if this Method object is enforcing Java language access control and the underlying method is inaccessible
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if it fails to open a PrintStream for fileName
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if there is no method to generate the implementation in the specified language

      • print_code

                                   throws java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException,
                                          java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Generates and prints code output for the implementation of a given automaton in the specified language to System.out. The generated code exports an acceptance method which allows to test whether a given string is accepted by the automaton or not.

      • show

        public static java.lang.Object show(pt.up.fe.comp.fsa.FSA lhs,
                    java.lang.String... options)
        Creates a temporary dot file for the automaton and uses ZGRViewer to visualize it. Must have Graphviz installed.

        Additionally, it supports the command line options for ZGRViewer, which can be of types: opengl ZVTM will run in OpenGL accelerated mode"); (requires JDK 1.5 or later)\n"); Pxxx where xxx={dot, neato, svg} to specify what program"); to use to compute the [file]'s layout\n"); pluginDir= where is the relative of full path to"); the directory where to look for plugins"); pluginList= where is a list of comma-separated relative"); to the JAR files that contain plugins"); pluginList takes precedence over -pluginDir\n"); pluginMode= plugin mode enabled by default in tool palette\n");

        Parameters:
        lhs - automaton to visualize
        options - options for ZGRViewer, must be enclosed by double quotes (see description)
        Returns:
        returns null
